vocab.ecosystem.definition: An ecosystem is a community of living things and their environment.
vocab.ecosystem.example: Example: The pond ecosystem has plants, fish, and insects.
vocab.observation.definition: Observation means using your senses to notice details.
vocab.observation.example: Example: We made an observation about the birds.
vocab.predator.definition: A predator is an animal that hunts other animals for food.
vocab.predator.example: Example: The owl is a predator.
story.main: Lee and Tee visit the city park. They observe birds hunting insects near the pond and write down what they see.
story.title: City Park Investigation
story.intro: Follow Lee and Tee as they collect clues about ecosystems.
story.segment.one: Lee points to the pond and notices birds swooping toward the water for insects.
story.segment.two: Tee writes down the observation so they can compare it later.
story.segment.three: They talk about how the insects and birds depend on the pond plants.
story.segment.four: Lee and Tee decide to share their notes with the class.
story.hint.one: Look for details that show who is hunting.
story.hint.two: Think about what a scientist records.
story.hint.three: Notice which organisms depend on each other.
story.hint.four: Think about how sharing helps the team.
